Text:
At present, the Cult of Diablos shows no sign of
activity, and our intelligence gathering in each
country is progressing smoothly.
End of report.
Hmm.

(One of my important duties is to collate reports
from Shadow Garden members scattered in each
country and keep Master Shadow informed.)

(I'm a nervous wreck no matter how many times I
report to Master Shadow. If I give incorrect or
insufficient information, his divine-like intuition
instantly detects it.)

(But, at the same time, I'm proud that it's a job
only I can do.)

I am at your service if you wish to follow up on
anything in this report...
Silence.

(I usually leave the room quietly after I finish
giving my report so as not to disturb Master
Shadow's thoughts.)
(And today is no different—)
Please excuse me.
Is that everything?

(He seldom asks me to repeat the content of my
reports. After all, Master Shadow can predict
everything going on in the world, so he doesn't
need to verify.)

(Therefore, if he purposely asks me to repeat
something, it means there's a problem.)

(I made my report the same way I always do, but did I
get overconfident and slip up somewhere?)
That's everything... I think?
As I echo his question, it suddenly dawns on me.

(The problem wasn't with what I had reported, but
what I hadn't. There is in fact something that I didn't
confirm with Master Shadow.)

(I didn't intend to hide anything, but I'd avoided
asking about a topic that I find hard to discuss.)

(Still, Master Shadow saw through it all. Even that I
was conflicted about whether or not to mention it.)

(Moreover, I am now being tested... Will I, or will I
not ask?)

(Did Master Shadow drop his gaze...?! Is he
disappointed that I couldn't answer his question
immediately?!)

(I definitely don't want to disappoint Master Shadow.
This is no time for insecurity...!)

U-Um... I wasn't sure whether to mention this or not,
as it is unrelated to my regular reports...

Could I possibly take up a little more of your time,
Master Shadow?
Go ahead...

(Thank goodness. If he's showing interest, then I
haven't been a total disappointment!)

(However, I can see by his despondent face that I
won't get another chance if I disappoint him again!)

The other day, at the Dark Knight Academy, Master
Shadow confessed his...love to Princess Alexia Midgar...?
I continue speaking while watching my lord's reaction.

(That's right. First, just confirm the facts.
There shouldn't be a problem if I do that.)

I came to this conclusion based on many testimonies
and highly credible sources which support the facts...

That being said, and intelligence being what it is,
I thought it wise to double-check its veracity with
you, Master Shadow.
*sigh*...

(Master sighs and his eyes fill with deep sadness.
Perhaps I shouldn't have brought it up...)

(But... I want to know. I really do! Not because of
any jealousy or craving for gossip...)
(N-No! That would be in very poor taste!)

(As a member of the Shadow Garden, I need to know
what Master Shadow's motive is. That is all...!)

A-Ahem! The word "confession" is commonly used, but
its meaning changes when the object of confession is
a princess of Midgar Kingdom.

Do you plan on entering Midgar's Royal Household to
obtain high-level intelligence, or to prepare for battle
against the Cult by using government office, and by
extension, the Order of Dark Knights?

In any case, I can only speculate on the deeper
reasoning behind this action.

Accordingly, I'd be...delighted if you could reveal
your true intentions to me...
Hmm...

His response is neither positive nor negative.
He raises his head and gazes wistfully into the
distance. What could it mean?

Master Shadow still won't give details. His silence
tells me that he'd rather deal with it himself.

I apologize for my intrusion. I shall leave
everything up to you, Master Shadow.

If possible, I'd have liked to know just a fragment
of your thoughts, but if now is not the time, I shall
wait until the right moment.

No response. If he doesn't reply, there is no reason
to remain here.

(Right...the Shadow Garden should trust in Master
Shadow, while obeying his orders in silence.）

(Because Master Shadow, with his divine insight and
judgement, never makes a mistake!)
Please excuse me, Master Shadow.
Hmm.

*yawn*... I'm sleepy. I was up all last night working
on an assignment, so I wanted to cut today's report
short.

After I asked "Is that everything?" Beta went on and
on and on...
But I didn't expect her to bring up Alexia. How'd she know?

I was impressed with how Beta included it without
straying from the plot. She's good at thinking on
her feet.

But... I can't keep my eyes open. Time for a little
sleep...

Beta stops writing and stares at the desk, sighing
repeatedly.

*sigh*... My writing of "The Chronicles of Master
Shadow" is going nowhere with all this fretting over
Master Shadow and Princess Alexia's relationship...

Materials lay in careless piles and an unfinished
manuscript lies strewn across the desk beside her
still ink brush.

What's got you so upset, Beta? There's no way Master
Shadow could be snared by a girl like her. It's all part
of his cunning plan!

To prepare for the next battle with the Cult of
Diablos, he needs to be with Princess Alexia.
That's why Master Shadow made the decision
to confess his love to her.
I'm sure of it! There can't be any other reason!

However...as it stands now, the Shadow Chronicles are
in dire need of a heroine.
Ah...! No! No way!

For the sake of argument, let's say I allow the
princess to get close to Master Shadow.

However, there's no way on earth that I'll turn a
girl who became Master Shadow's classmate by
chance into a heroine of the story, just because
she's of somewhat noble lineage.

After all, I heard she bluntly declared that she
didn't like Master Shadow's magnificent sword
skills... Why would I make such a rude girl the
heroine?

There's someone more suited to Master Shadow than her!
For instance, a cute elf with silver hair, blue eyes and a
mole under her eye!

Beta stands and speaks with great enthusiasm to the
portraits of Master Shadow plastered to the wall.

Due to whatever circumstances, you've had to tolerate
rude and humiliating treatment from that girl. It pains me...

Of course, I'm talking about Alexia Midgar...
It seems that further investigation is needed.

Whatever it takes, I'm going to show him the wolf in
sheep's clothing that she really is!
